summary: This is a court subpoena issued by the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York to T-Mobile, commanding the company to produce subscriber records for a specified phone number from 2000-2005 and to appear before the court on November 29, 2021, in relation to the criminal case United States v. Ghislaine Maxwell.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The subject of the criminal case (20 Cr. 330 (AJN)) for which the subpoena is issued.

persons.name: Audrey Strauss
persons.context: Signed the subpoena as the United States Attorney for the Southern District of New York.

events.title: Scheduled Court Appearance for T-Mobile
events.description: T-Mobile is commanded to appear before the United States District Court for the Southern District of New York to testify and produce subscriber records.

events.title: Subpoena Issued
events.description: The subpoena is dated and issued by the U.S. Attorney's Office.

locations: Borough of Manhattan, City of New York, New York
keyFacts: A subpoena was issued to T-Mobile to produce subscriber records for a specific phone number from the period 2000-2005.
The subpoena is related to the criminal case United States v. Ghislaine Maxwell (20 Cr. 330 (AJN)).
T-Mobile was commanded to appear in court on November 29, 2021, at 9:00 a.m.
Failure to comply would constitute contempt of court, subjecting T-Mobile to civil sanctions and criminal penalties.
The subpoena was signed by U.S. Attorney Audrey Strauss on July 28, 2021.
